markAsAccountedDialog.title: Mark as Accounted
markAsAccountedDialog.description: Are you sure you want to mark this order as accounted? This action is irreversible and means that all overtime has been accounted for in the payroll system.

toast.onlyHR: Only HR employees can mark orders as accounted!

toast.tooManyEmployees: Maximum number of employees exceeded for this order!
toast.unauthorized: No permission to modify this order!
toast.error: An error occurred while adding employee!

approveRequestDialog.title: Approve Order
approveRequestDialog.description: Are you sure you want to approve this overtime work order?

toast.onlyPlantManager: Only plant manager can approve orders!

cancelRequestDialog.title: Cancel Order?
cancelRequestDialog.description: Are you sure you want to cancel this overtime work order? This action cannot be undone.

cancel.title: Cancel Order?
cancel.description: Are you sure you want to cancel this overtime work order? This action cannot be undone.

delete.title: Delete Order?
delete.description: Are you sure you want to PERMANENTLY delete this overtime work order? This operation cannot be undone.

reactivate.title: Reactivate Order?
reactivate.description: Are you sure you want to reactivate this canceled overtime work order?

newOvertimeRequestForm.title: New Overtime Work Order
newOvertimeRequestForm.startWorkDescription: Start of shift or first shift when number of shifts is greater than 1.
newOvertimeRequestForm.endWorkDescription: End of shift or last shift when number of shifts is greater than 1.
newOvertimeRequestForm.numberOfShiftsDescription: We assume each shift has equal length. If shift lengths differ, add separate orders.
newOvertimeRequestForm.responsibleDescription: Select the person supervising overtime work – they will be required to submit the attendance list.
newOvertimeRequestForm.reasonDescription: Provide the reason for overtime work.
newOvertimeRequestForm.scheduledDayOffDescription: Employees who are picking up a day off for overtime work.

accordion.restPeriodContent: The employee maintained at least 11 hours of uninterrupted rest in each 24-hour period and at least 35 hours of uninterrupted weekly rest (for employees changing shifts, the rest period cannot be shorter than 24 hours).
accordion.brussStandardContent: For work on Sundays and holidays, an employee for whom this is the 7th consecutive working day receives a day off (in accordance with Labor Code regulations – see: Information / legal basis) and a wage supplement of 100% of the wage for each hour of work.
accordion.legalInfoContent2: 2. Working time including overtime cannot exceed 13 hours per day - overtime above 13 hours is not permitted
accordion.legalInfoContent3: 3. Weekly working time including overtime cannot exceed an average of 48 hours in the adopted settlement period
accordion.legalInfoContent4: 4. In accordance with Article 15111 of the Labor Code, an employee working on Sundays and holidays should take a day off from work within six calendar days preceding or following such Sunday, for work on a holiday – by the end of the settlement period, and if this is not possible, the employee has the right to another day off from work by the end of the settlement period. If granting such a day is also not possible in this period, the employee is entitled to a wage supplement of 100% of the wage for each hour of work on Sunday/holiday.
accordion.legalInfoContent5: The facility operates a basic system (Article 129 of the Labor Code – daily standard 8h and average weekly 40h in a five-day work week). Legal basis: Article 131, Article 132, Article 133, Article 151§3 and 4, Article 151(1), Article 151(11) of the Labor Code.

editOvertimeRequestForm.title: Edit Overtime Work Order
editOvertimeRequestForm.startWorkDescription: Start of shift or first shift when number of shifts is greater than 1.
editOvertimeRequestForm.endWorkDescription: End of shift or last shift when number of shifts differs from 1.
editOvertimeRequestForm.numberOfShiftsDescription: We assume each shift has equal length. If shift lengths differ, add separate orders.
editOvertimeRequestForm.responsibleDescription: Select the person supervising overtime work – they will be required to submit the attendance list.
editOvertimeRequestForm.reasonDescription: Provide the reason for overtime work.
editOvertimeRequestForm.scheduledDayOffDescription: Employees who are picking up a day off for overtime work.

accordion.restPeriodContent: The employee maintained at least 11 hours of uninterrupted rest in each 24-hour period and at least 35 hours of uninterrupted weekly rest (for employees changing shifts, the rest period cannot be shorter than 24 hours).
accordion.brussStandardContent: For work on Sundays and holidays, an employee for whom this is the 7th consecutive working day receives a day off (in accordance with Labor Code regulations – see: Information / legal basis) and a wage supplement of 100% of the wage for each hour of work.
accordion.legalInfoContent2: 2. Working time including overtime cannot exceed 13 hours per day - overtime above 13 hours is not permitted
accordion.legalInfoContent3: 3. Weekly working time including overtime cannot exceed an average of 48 hours in the adopted settlement period
accordion.legalInfoContent4: 4. In accordance with Article 15111 of the Labor Code, an employee working on Sundays and holidays should take a day off from work within six calendar days preceding or following such Sunday, for work on a holiday – by the end of the settlement period, and if this is not possible, the employee has the right to another day off from work by the end of the settlement period. If granting such a day is also not possible in this period, the employee is entitled to a wage supplement of 100% of the wage for each hour of work on Sunday/holiday.
accordion.legalInfoContent5: The facility operates a basic system (Article 129 of the Labor Code – daily standard 8h and average weekly 40h in a five-day work week). Legal basis: Article 131, Article 132, Article 133, Article 151§3 and 4, Article 151(1), Article 151(11) of the Labor Code.

toast.unauthorized: You don't have permission to edit this order
toast.invalidStatus: Cannot edit order in this status

multiSelectEmployees.dialogTitle: Agreed day off pickup date for: {firstName} {lastName}

bulkActions.noCommonActions: No common actions for selected orders.

confirmApprove.title: Approve Selected Orders
confirmApprove.description: Are you sure you want to approve {count} {plural}?

confirmCancel.title: Cancel Selected Orders
confirmCancel.description: Are you sure you want to cancel {count} {plural}?

confirmAccount.title: Account Selected Orders
confirmAccount.description: Are you sure you want to account {count} {plural}?

confirmDelete.title: Confirm Day Off Pickup Deletion
confirmDelete.description: Are you sure you want to delete the day off pickup for employee: {firstName} {lastName} ({identifier})?

validation.numberOfEmployeesMin: Number of employees must be at least 1!
validation.numberOfShiftsMin: Number of shifts must be at least 1!
validation.fromDateInPast: Start cannot be in the past!
validation.toDateInPast: End cannot be in the past!
validation.durationMin1h: Scheduled work time must be at least 1h!
validation.employeesExceedsTotal: Number of employees picking up days off cannot exceed total number of employees!
validation.durationNotWholeOrHalf: Work time must be expressed in whole hours or accurate to half an hour!
validation.pendingArticleNotAdded: You haven't added the selected article! Click "+" to add or clear the fields.

department.label: Department
department.description: Select the department for which overtime is ordered.

tableColumnsExtra.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to PERMANENTLY delete this order? This operation is irreversible.

completeOrderForm.title: Close Order
completeOrderForm.description: Closing the order includes uploading the attendance list and providing the actual number of employees and produced articles. After closing, the order status will change to completed.

toast.unauthorized: You don't have permission to add the attendance list.
toast.successSingle: Order closed successfully! {count} file uploaded and converted to PDF. Order status changed to completed.
toast.successMultiple: Order closed successfully! {count} files uploaded and merged to PDF. Order status changed to completed.
toast.fileAlreadyExists: One of the files already exists
toast.untranslatedError: An error occurred while adding attachments
toast.uploadError: An error occurred while uploading files

errors.fileTooLarge: One of the files exceeds the allowed size (10MB)
errors.totalSizeExceeds: Total file size exceeds the allowed limit (50MB)
errors.fileExists: A file with this name already exists
